newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean gold market seen slow on economic slump.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean gold market seen slow on economic slump.

text.p: The South Korean gold market was expected to be bearish this week as the nation's continued economic downturn depressed gold demand, Seoul traders said on Tuesday.
"The economic slowdown will keep this week's gold trading bearish," said a trader with LG Metals Corp.
The South Korean bullion market will be closed on Wednesday for Buddha's Birthday.
But traders said a recovery in world market prices stemming from the dollar's fall against other major currencies had raised the domestic gold price.

Gold producer LG Metals' daily selling price for the precious metal, which is regarded as a benchmark for the local bullion wholesale market, rose on Tuesday to 10,360 won per gram from 10,250 won a week ago.
The company's silver price also rose to 154 won a gram from 152 won a week earlier.

The telegraphic transfer selling rate for customers, posted by the Korea Exchange Bank, rose to 894.10 won against the dollar from 895.40 won a week ago. The rate is regarded as a benchmark of local foreign exchange rates for companies.
